Name: Snow White Daiquiri
Ingredients: 30 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
30 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
3 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lime zest twist and pineapple wedge.
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Express lime zest twist over cocktail and discard.
Garnish with pineapple wedge on rim.
Review: Sip through a thick white foamy head to enjoy the layers of rum-laced, innocently fruity delights below.
History: Adapted from a recipe in David A. Embury 's 1948 book The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks .
Nutrition: One serving of Snow White Daiquiri contains 175 calories
